name: Radisson Blu Edwardian Mercer Street Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weekend was a surprise wedding gift from my husband after a terrible year and i couldn't have asked for more. On the journey up i tweeted that i was looking forward to staying at the Mercer St hotel and received a response immediately wishing us a good stay. We parked at Heathrow long stay and the Picadilly Line runs direct to to Covent Garden and then its a 2 min walk to the hotel which is located on a small corner in a lovely central but quiet location.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is beautiful and gives a great first impression, and the staff were very welcoming. While checking in the receptionist asked the reason for our stay and on hearing it was a mini honeymoon we were upgraded to a suite on 7th floor!!!!
reviews.title: Excellent location, service. Cold room :)

reviews.text: The suite was beautiful complete with walk in dressing room with lit make up mirror full size fridge and espresso machine and the bathroom toiletries were full size just amazing all round.
reviews.title: the room you get is the same as the picture on the website!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service was reasonably priced for quality of hotel and its location.
reviews.title: Modern deco, comfortable room right in centre of Covent Garden

reviews.text: Breakfast was amazing everything on the buffet from cereals, cold meats and cheese to Yakult and smoothies. Also full english breakfast as well as the buffet!
reviews.title: Terrible afternoon tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in early March. It is a boutique hotel right at 7 Dials and close to Soho and other interesting areas of London. We originally got a room on a low floor and since this was a Saturday night we could not move until the hotel emptied out a bit the next day. On Sunday they put us on the highest floor of the hotel which felt less claustrophobic. The room was pretty much identical, except for the bathroom layout.
reviews.title: Very well located and pretty comfortable

reviews.text: The rooms are not exactly large but comfortable enough. Even though the area right outside the hotel is lively, not even our room on the lower floor was affected by any noise from the street (there are various pubs all around). It seemed to quiet down fairly early actually (for adult bedtimes that is) so we were quite pleased to get a peaceful night's sleep after a long flight.
reviews.title: complete disaster

reviews.text: I checked in at 10:30 and got told that my room will be ready at 1 or 2 pm. I returned at 2 pm and the room wasn't ready. Front desk told me I have to wait 20-25 minutes. I returned at 2:30pm and the room was not ready. Finally at 2:45 they got the room ready for me!
reviews.title: Little gem in WC2
Fab Easter Break!!
reviews.text: On room 502 the TV was not working "Unable to start TV, please contact reception". After 45min the house technician came, figured out that Apple TV needs to be restarted at the router and gave me the regular remote control.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the restaurant the rolls came directly out of the microwave. They were wizen and so hot that they stuck on the napkin.
reviews.title: Raddison blu edwardian,Covent garden

reviews.text: Nice hotel, with stylish decor, comfortable beds (could do with nice pillows please). Great location in Covent Garden, so close to everything central. Downside is no parking on site but normally I suppose people are not driving.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps one complaint is that breakfast staff, though polite, were not very professional. I had eggshells in my scrambled eggs but no one seemed to care. We were only there 1 night so did not make a fuss. Not a big deal and will not stop me from returning.
reviews.title: Value for money???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked as 'secret hotel' through LM.com. Was apparently a deluxe (or maybe Superior) room, I say apparently, because we did wonder what warranted the title. The room was a fair size, nicely decorated, as you would expect, but the bathroom was tiny, hardly room to turn around in. Shower was nice though. Bed was only a standard double and was not particularly comfortable, which is probably the main reason we wondered whether this was indeed a deluxe room, because I would expect the minimum spec for a deluxe room would be a king size. TV had good selection of channels and picture was good.
reviews.title: some parts were fantastic. some was a let down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didnt eat at the hotel, so can't comment, but did have one drink in the bar - very expensive and wished we had visited the pub opposite.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.text: A very expensive room for what it was in out opinion. Although its location was excellent for Covent Garden and local area and we would should expect the price to be high, this was not value for money and wished we had shopped around or stayed a bit further out.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, staff and location
Very Good Staff
reviews.text: On arrival we checked in went to our room and it was tiny, only really ment for one person. We went to reception to complain, they up graded us at a small cost to a suit. It was really nice. We went out and then came back to change only to find the was a power cut. We were advised that it would be back on shortly and it was the whole street without power, so we waited.......still no power so we called reception as the was no hot water even for a shower. They were SO helpfull they offered us a suit in there other hotel just a 5 min walk away so we want for that option. I can't say enough how helpfull and obliging the staff were. I would defiantly recommend it.

The rooms are tiny, just too small and annoying to move around. I had an incident where someone did my room from houskeeping and gone through my bag as well. Also who ever did that was in a hurry or paniced because they spilled water on the carpet from the water heater which obviously seemed to have fallen on the floor because there was 1 mug back by the wall behind the seat which was never picked up! Mgmt ackowledged & informed they would investigate, but never emailed me about the incident.
reviews.title: New hotel good location, very small rooms.

reviews.text: The location is quite close to the underground and just outside the hotel is a Nero Caffe. The setting of the hotel is modern and elegant, the breakfast was average with the normal pancakes, omelette and very small buffet.
reviews.title: Lovely location, average hotel rooms, horrible staff

reviews.text: The hotel is set in an amazing location in the heart of Covent Garden. It's an wasy walk from Leicester Square and Covent Garden tube stations and has lots of restaurants, bars an shops around.
reviews.title: Clean, modern and in an excellent location

reviews.text: I found the hotel rooms were very nice and clean but tiny!
reviews.title: A Must Stay Place!!!
